[### Visit Us

In the heart of Texas, lies the tranquil town of San Saba. With small-town roots and Texas-sized spirit, San Saba is more than you imagined.](https://sansabatexas.com/about-san-saba/visitor-center/)
[### Calendar

Our Events Calendar is your resource for local government meetings and hearings as well as local events of interest for both you and the family.](https://sansabatexas.com/events)
[### Pay Online

Welcome to our online payment website featuring the available services of Easy Pay and Utility Billing.](https://sansabatx.municipalonlinepayments.com/sansabatx)
[### Report an Issue

Contact information includes our city departments, city police, and animal control during workday hours and after-hours numbers.](https://sansabatexas.com/contact/report-a-problem/)

### About Us

1854
1700
AD
3122
1000
Texans

Known as the
and located on the northern edge of the Edwards Plateau, San Saba features beautiful views and landscapes as well as excellent schools, parks, home-owned retail businesses and restaurants, backed by city-owned utilities and an endless supply of water.

[Know More](https://sansabatexas.com/about-san-saba/)

![Pecan nuts on a wooden table](https://sansabatexas.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/GettyImages-665467592.jpg)

* [![](https://sansabatexas.com/wp-content/uploads/2026/01/tent-view-1024x730-1.jpg)](https://sansabatexas.com/catkins-ball-2/)


  #### [Catkins Ball](https://sansabatexas.com/catkins-ball-2/)

  The Catkins Ball, sponsored by The Community Foundation of San Saba County, is an annual fundraiser held the last Saturday in April in scenic Risien Park. It is a gala affair showcased in elegant, tented surroundings featuring a traditional cocktail hour, gourmet dinner, and dance following the live auction.
  [See More
  Catkins Ball](https://sansabatexas.com/catkins-ball-2/)
* [![Night at the Museum Annual Fundraiser](https://sansabatexas.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/city_slide_museum_fundraiser.jpg)](https://sansabatexas.com/night-at-the-museum-2/)


  #### [Night at the Museum](https://sansabatexas.com/night-at-the-museum-2/)

  One of the community’s favorite spring events is the annual Night at the Museum, benefitting the San Saba County Historical Museum, housed in Mill Pond Park. The fundraiser is the first Saturday in March from 4:00 p.m. until 7:00 p.m. celebrating Texas Independence with live demonstrations, speakers, campfire cooking, and more. Live music and country…
  [See More
  Night at the Museum](https://sansabatexas.com/night-at-the-museum-2/)
* [![](https://sansabatexas.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/IMG_0181-2.jpg)](https://sansabatexas.com/lighted-christmas-parade-historic-downtown-san-saba/)


  #### [Lighted Christmas Parade @Downtown San Saba](https://sansabatexas.com/lighted-christmas-parade-historic-downtown-san-saba/)

  The Annual Lighted Christmas Parade, sponsored by the San Saba County Chamber of Commerce, is the second Saturday in December beginning at 6:30 p.m. in historic downtown San Saba. Join us for twinkling floats, holiday cheer, and small-town magic at its best!
  [See More
  Lighted Christmas Parade @Downtown San Saba](https://sansabatexas.com/lighted-christmas-parade-historic-downtown-san-saba/)
* [![](https://sansabatexas.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/sip-dyers-fb.jpg)](https://sansabatexas.com/sip-n-stroll-downtown-san-saba/)


  #### [Sip ‘n Stroll @Downtown San Saba](https://sansabatexas.com/sip-n-stroll-downtown-san-saba/)

  Join us the second Saturday in December for the Annual Sip N’ Stroll & Lighted Christmas Parade, sponsored by the San Saba County Chamber of Commerce. Wander the charming streets of historic downtown San Saba as Texas Hill Country wineries treat you to exclusive tastings and sales. With your ticket, you’ll enjoy wine tastings while…
  [See More
  Sip ‘n Stroll @Downtown San Saba](https://sansabatexas.com/sip-n-stroll-downtown-san-saba/)
* [![](https://sansabatexas.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/mill-pond-lights.jpg)](https://sansabatexas.com/dancing-lights-mill-pond-park/)


  #### [Dancing Lights @Mill Pond Park](https://sansabatexas.com/dancing-lights-mill-pond-park/)

  Thanksgiving night marks the annual opening of the Dancing Lights at Mill Pond Park. Set your radio to 88.7 FM and enjoy synced music to over 30 acres of seasonal magic. View nightly through January 5th. Admission is free.
  [See More
  Dancing Lights @Mill Pond Park](https://sansabatexas.com/dancing-lights-mill-pond-park/)
* [![](https://sansabatexas.com/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/welcome-hunters-25.png)](https://sansabatexas.com/annual-hunters-welcome/)


  #### [Annual Hunter’s Welcome](https://sansabatexas.com/annual-hunters-welcome/)

  The annual Hunters Welcome, sponsored by the San Saba County Chamber of Commerce, is the Friday prior to the first weekend marking the opening of Deer Season. Held at Lowe’s Market, hunters receive free gift bags while supplies last. Hunters may also purchase tickets for a chance to win in the annual fundraiser supporting the…
  [See More
  Annual Hunter’s Welcome](https://sansabatexas.com/annual-hunters-welcome/)

[More from News](https://sansabatexas.com/news/)

#### Work with the City of San Saba!

The City of San Saba is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applications can be picked up at City Hall, located at 303 S Clear Street, Monday through Thursday from 7:30 a.m. until 5:30 p.m. and Friday 7:30 a.m. until 11:30 a.m.

[View Opportunities](https://sansabatexas.com/contact/careers/)

#### Know More About

The San Saba Visitor’s Center has information on where to eat, stay and play! The center also houses the Economic Development Commission, Keep San Saba Beautiful Commission, and the San Saba County Chamber of Commerce.

[See More](https://sansabatexas.com/about-san-saba/visitor-center/)

![building in sunlight](https://sansabatexas.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/visitor-center-1024x768.jpg)




![San Saba logo](https://sansabatexas.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/cropped-Logo-CITY-SS-2017-Cap-Pecan-Capital-1-1-1.png)

Hours of Operation
Monday – Thursday: 7:30am – 5:30pm
Friday: 7:30am – 11:30am
